name: Hotel Plaza Colon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 times - 2 nights each time (about 4 days apart). First we were in a room downstairs (102 I think) and the second time upstairs in 201. We tied to get a balcony room but none were available. While we were their the first time we tried to make a reservation for the second stay and they were full. Talked to the resevation manager (Jo An - not Joan) and he was able to 'move things around' and find us a room. Also, want to point this out (talk about service) - I was having trouble with wi-fi. I was trying to send an e-mail to Jo An and later found him in the busines center. Anyway, in the meantime Carlos the bell boy realized that I was having a problem with the wi fi and he gets the IT lady to the room to set up the router in the room itself so I can get a better signal. Since I had already accomplished what I wanted I did not need it. To me this is what you call going the extra mile. He was also helpful with a restaurant recomendation and having them provide free transport. He also arranged a taxi for a friend that was staying at another hotel.
reviews.title: Nice welcoming and relaxing Hotel

reviews.text: Then there was Virginia (guest relations). I went to arrange airport transportation, she knew that I was a returning customer, knew the name and room number. Plus she left a welcome note in the room with some choclates.
reviews.title: My home in Granada

reviews.text: Many of the staff greeted us by name the second time around and the "welcome back" was very common. This Hotel sure knows how to train the staff. The only thing that baffles me was the first time around we had two queen beds - they only made up one bed after the first night. The other bed, towels, bathroom were all taken care of - just not the second bed and all the extra pillows of both beds were on the second bed???? - did not bother us, so did not say anything.
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and comfortable, plenty of hot water and nice shower with good water pressure. The location is great - right next to the park (square). Breakfast was good with made to order eggs, bacon, fruit, etc. Did not get a chance to take a dip in the pool but looked clean and relaxing.
reviews.title: great stay and location in Granada

reviews.text: We were in four different hotels during this trip and this Hotel was by far the best.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before booking our stay at the Hotel Plaza Colon, I researched every hotel in Granada. I like to be very thorough. After reading reviews and speaking to some locals that I know, we ended up here. It was absolutely a fantastic stay from start to finish. First, when booking, I was a little frightened about giving my credit card info before the stay through email/fax. No worries there - everything is on the up and up with this hotel. I specifically requested a park view balcony room and would not recommend anything else. Whatever the (small) extra charge is, it is worth every penny. Through my initial interactions with the hotel, I requested that they arrange my transportation to the hotel from MGA. That was the best decision we could have made! They booked us through Paxeos and we were met as soon as we got off the plane with a representative holding a sign with our name. They guided us through customs, getting our luggage, and got us right into a vehicle with our driver. We were in and out in less than 10 minutes. Also, having not been to this airport before, it is not like your American airport with large stations for shuttles or other things. So, definitely have the hotel arrange this for you!
reviews.title: Don't look anywhere else - stay here!

reviews.text: Upon arrival, our bags were immediately unloaded for us and taken to our room which was ready. The room was spacious and opened directly onto the Parque. This was the most exquisite view and you really got a sense for the culture from just sitting out on the balcony and relaxing. The balcony is shared with the room next to you, and you also share a sitting area with them. So, if you are getting two rooms, you would have an amazing suite! The bed was very comfortable and everything was very clean. Two bottles of complementary water were included with the room.
reviews.title: Simply incredible!

reviews.text: Quality of sheets and towels was about what I expected for Nicaragua. We had no issues with bugs or any issues with theft. The staff greeted us and they were so friendly and eager to help throughout our stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to stay in Granada, Nica

reviews.text: For breakfast, it is included. We walked downstairs and saw a buffet of fresh fruit, cereal & milk, orange juice, and coffee and thought - hmmm, not much of a breakfast. BUT, once we sat down, a waiter came over and offered us a choice of American breakfast (eggs/meat/toast), Nica breakfast (eggs/biscuit/beans), or pancakes. I had the Nica and my husband had the pancakes and both were phenomenal!!!! Really great breakfast and you eat outside in the courtyard which is lovely.
reviews.title: Oasis of comfort
Can't wait to go back!
reviews.text: We ate at El Zaguan for dinner (as it seems many tourists do). My husband had the Nica platter with the most amazing steak. Seriously, we go to very nice steak restaurants all the time and this was cheap, tender, delicious steak. I was very impressed. I had the tortilla soup which was delicious. The restaurant is cheap for American standards and it was fun. However, the waitstaff struggles with English, so know some Spanish to go there. Try a Tona, it's the local beer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner booked this hotel for our 1 night stay in Granada. (he had stayed there previously and now wanted to share it with me)
reviews.title: Awesome service before AND after stay.

reviews.text: Besides a HUGE room and gorgeous pool open area where we had a lovely complementary breakfast the staff were always pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Hotel Plaza Colon is a wonderful place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It didn't end there. Later, when I was in Managua I discovered I had left a jacket at the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel with a terrific staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I e-mailed them and told them that I would try to secure UPS or FedEx to get it (that way I could pay for the pickup from home {Canada}). When I found out FedEx wanted $60.00 I almost said forget it. I emailed the hotel to ask if they could let me know how much it would be to send it via regular post.
reviews.title: Love the Hotel Plaza Colon!

reviews.text: Maria, contacted me and said that it would be her pleasure to return it gratis. I was flabbergasted.
reviews.title: Beautiful & great service

reviews.text: All I can say is "AMAZING"!! The hotel is wonderful! it is perfectly located within the city. Walking distance to almost everything (bars, restaurants, clubs, etc). They sever a complimentary breakfast (very good!!).
reviews.title: Amazing & HAUNTED!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is haunted. I know many people will not believe this but at 5am in the morning our shower turned on and water ran for about 15 minutes after realizing that everyone was in bed. it was very spooky but yet exciting. You can hear footsteps at times especially when the hotel is empty (which happened on my last night). I did not see anything with my own eyes, but certainly can experience some spooky activity. Comments from their employees also confirmed my suspicion of the place being haunted and not my mind playing tricks. The employees have confirmed that they also heard and hear at times footsteps on the top floors when the hotel is empty. Also other guests have experienced their bathroom doors close and open. If you are into thriller experience it's a must. I loved it and would definitely stay there.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel fabulous balcony beds are hard and pool is tiny

reviews.text: The Hotel is beautiful and EXCELLENT SERVICE!!!
reviews.title: Good Location, Good Service

reviews.text: Loved the location and the balcony was heavenly ... the room was large ...the bathroom was not ... but the bed was hard as a rock. Yet, we would return here in a heartbeat because of the charming location, room size and ambience
reviews.title: Excellent Service, great facility, and perfect site.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with a Balcony overlooking the square, there was a problem with the original double room we had booked but they gave us a king room at a discounted rate. The service was good and friendly and we had no problem checking out at 3 in the morning to catch our flight. The location is great, I thought being on the square it might be a bit noisy at night but it was fine.
reviews.title: We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Granada
Granada, Nicaragua.
reviews.text: Just was in this town last week. I'm in Mexico right now with a beautiful girl who I will marry but that is another story that is just beginning.

From the hotel Colon overlooking central square you can take horse and buggy rides for $2 around town. The food I ate at some restaurant was deliceous. Chicken beef or fish was the menue with salad and rice. I got the beef and it was tender and especially nice! Normally beef down in central America is rather tuff. There are guys on ice cream bikes and children that follow you around. Not to steal but beg. Not so bad and they are very helpful at getting you around and some speak English. Beware of the adults dressed in tour outfits that follow you around helping carry your bags. They only want $2 or less for their help but it gets to be annoying after a bit. I liked the kids! They were like my friends after a bit.
reviews.title: Hotel Plaza Colon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Volcano's were neat to see. There is a boat trip through the islands that is a must. My diabetic amputee unstable on a walker father did the trip with me. The guys carried him to and from the boat practically. It was great and I bought a dozen mandrines for $0.80 and t shirts were $4 hats wee $2. I liked it there. Everybody seemed poor but happy. There isn't the tourist traps there like in Mexico or even Costa Rica now. I plan on going back!
reviews.title: One of the best hotel experiences we've ever had
A very nice stay
reviews.text: Perfect Location, perfect way to see Granada. I stayed at the Hotel Plaza Colon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: in February for 3 nights with 2 friends. We could not have asked for more from the hotel
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I liked the most about Hotel Plaza Colon was the hospitality of all the personnel, everyone greets with a warm smile and is alert to any of the guests needs. Hotel Plaza Colon is a beautifully renovated Spanish colonial style building converted into what people are now calling “hotel boutique”. Clean rooms, free internet and breakfast included. The front desk staff helped us book the tour to the Isletas and surrounding areas. They also recommended a great place to dine, if you go, don’t miss El Zaguan, which is about two blocks from the hotel. This was my first time in Nicaragua and absolutely loved it!
reviews.title: Charming Granada, a Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights here. Lovely place; great, clean rooms; helpful staff, especially Carlos, genuinely the nicest man ever, anything you need, Carlos can help. One thing: the morning we left, my wife bought a croissant from the Don Simon coffee shop located in the hotel. It was moldy in the bottom, the counter person saw this, but still sold it to her. My wife did not noticed until after a couple of bites, and by then we were out of Granada. Then she realized why it took so long for them to give her the croissant. Despite this unfortunate situation, I still love this place. Watch out for the croissants, though!
reviews.title: loved it!

reviews.text: This is a friendly little gem of a hotel, on the perfect location in Granada, on the central park. The rooms are new, colonial style, with wireless internet, in-room safes. There is a little pool. Buffet breakfast in the courtyard in the morning. There is not a full restaurant here, but a little snack shop in the front patio, and also a wine bar on the front patio. Friendly, helpful staff.
reviews.title: Great hotel on central park

reviews.text: Friendly and competent people, nice rooms, quiet and located in the center of the city. The prices of the rooms differs but price performance ratio is good.
reviews.title: Fine service, friendly people, good price/performance and located in the center, try Plaza Colon
When Considering a Hotel in Granada, Look No Further Than Hotel Plaza Colon
reviews.text: Let me start the review by stating that this was our first trip to Nicaragua. My wife and I were traveling with two other couples, age range from 50-60. We spent 10 days in Nicaragua, with three of them in Granada. I found Hotel Plaza Colon by reading the wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor and all who rated this hotel as excellent were right on target.
I have been to Granada several times and have tried a variety of hotels. This is the best so far.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.text: The service is excellent..staff professional and efficient..Mureil at the front desk was terrific and very resourceful..Carlos, the nice bartender..everyone was great!
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Granada

reviews.text: The breakfast is delicious and the location is ideal. It can get a little noisy on the square but
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend the Plaza Colon.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the Heart of Granada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here many times and each time has been perfect! Great service, food and lodging! Make sure to get a balcony room overlooking the square.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel, great service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived from Costa Rica with the Natureair flight on Friday, returned on Monday morning. Granada is an authentic, mostly intact Colonial city. The hotel is on the main plaza within walking distance to museums, art galleries and restaurants. Lily's cafe in the hotel has great coffee served in soup bowls and good food. The people at the hotel are super helpful and genuinely friendly. We loved this place.
reviews.title: Great weekend, beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: Excellent service. Hands down.
reviews.title: Amazing staff, amazing hotel

reviews.text: I have been here twice now and would definitely return if ever in Granada again.
reviews.title: Hotel Bar and outside veranda perfect for your Happy Hour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location; couldnt get better
reviews.title: If you are visiting Granada you have to stay here

reviews.text: Rooms; gorgeous - try for one with a big balcony over looking the park
reviews.title: Speechless

description: Located in front of the main plaza, Hotel Plaza Colon has become a landmark of the colonial city of Granada. Our top notch colonial style facilities and our 100% Nicaraguan staff will make your stay a memorable one.
